text: The 1992 ECO summit was the first Economic Cooperation Organization summit, held 16–17 February in Tehran, Iran. The summit welcomed the admission of new members Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan as well as allowing limited participation in economic, cultural and technical activities of Northern Cyprus. ==Attending delegations== {| class="wikitable" |- align=center | colspan="3" | Government leaders |- |Hashemi Rafsanjani |President | |- |Nawaz Sharif | Prime Minister | |- |Turgut Ozal |President | |- | Ekrem Ceyhun | Minister of State | |- |Ayaz Mutallibov |President | |- |Saparmurat Niyazov |President | |- |Bayknev | Deputy Prime Minister | |- |Erkibayev | Deputy Prime Minister | |- | Yuldashov Shokat Mohyedinouvich |Chairman of the High Council | |- | Lakim Qayumov |Foreign Minister | |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Diplomatic conferences in Iran Category:20th-century diplomatic conferences Category:1992 in Iran Category:1992 in international relations Category:1992 conferences Category:Economic Cooperation Organization Category:Tehran Category:20th century in Tehran
title: 1st ECO Summit
